intro: Drimys piperita var. membranea, commonly known as the Chilean pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the family Winteraceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, temperate climates and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves contain essential oils that contribute to its distinctive scent and medicinal properties. The variety 'membranea' is distinguished by its unique leaf structure and habitat preferences.
